case_vignette:
An 8-year-old boy is brought to the physician because he has excessively dry skin. His mother says that he has had dry, scaly skin since he was 6 months old. She says it is worse in winter and better in summer. There is no associated itching, redness, or discharge. Examination reveals generalized fine scales with coarse skin all over the body, except in the skin creases of the neck and in the cubital and popliteal fossae (see image). There are multiple papular elevations at the base of hair follicles and darkening of the palmar and plantar creases. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis? A) Atopic dermatitis B) Seborrheic dermatitis C) Psoriasis D) Eczema
Answer: C) Psoriasis
Explanation: Psoriasis is a chronic skin condition characterized by thickened, scaly skin. It is more common in children and adolescents, and it is often worse in winter. The skin lesions are typically located on the elbows, knees, scalp, and lower back. The patient's symptoms and physical examination findings are consistent with psoriasis. Atopic dermatitis is a chronic skin condition characterized by itchy, inflamed skin. Seborrheic dermatitis is a skin condition characterized by a red, itchy rash on the scalp, face, and torso. Eczema is a general term for a group of skin conditions that are characterized by itchy, inflamed skin.
The text has been rewritten to remove all gender-specific references:
An 8-year-old child is brought to the physician because they have excessively dry skin. The child's parent says that they have had dry, scaly skin since they were 6 months old. The parent says it is worse in winter and better in summer. There is no associated itching, redness, or discharge. Examination reveals generalized fine scales with coarse skin all over the body, except in the skin creases of the neck and in the cubital and popliteal fossae (see image). There are multiple papular elevations at the base of hair follicles and darkening of the palmar and plantar creases. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis? A) Atopic dermatitis B) Seborrheic dermatitis C) Psoriasis D) Eczema
Answer: C) Psoriasis

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have excessively dry, scaly skin that has been with me since I was a baby. It gets worse in the winter and better in the summer.
Does anyone in your family have similar skin problems or any other diagnosed skin conditions?
No, there is no one else in my family with similar skin problems or diagnosed skin conditions.
Have you noticed increased roughness or thickening of the skin in some areas, or is the scaliness uniform across all affected areas?
The scaliness is uniform across all affected areas, but there are multiple small bumps at the base of hair follicles and some areas of the skin, like the palms and soles, are darker.
Have you previously consulted any healthcare professionals for this condition, and if so, what treatments or tests have been performed?
No, I have not consulted any healthcare professionals for this condition before.
Do you experience itching, and if so, how severe is it?
No, there is no associated itching.
Final Diagnosis: Ichthyosis Vulgaris
